threaten.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to say that you will cause someone harm or trouble if they do not do what you want
threaten.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Postal workers are threatening a strike if they don’t receive a pay increase.
He threatened to take them to court.
Doctors are sometimes threatened with violence if they don’t do what patients want.
Then he became angry and threatened that he would go to the police.
threaten.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to be likely to harm or destroy something
threaten.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Poaching threatens the survival of the rhino.
The incident threatens to ruin his chances in the election.
Large areas of the jungle are now threatened with destruction.
threaten.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to be likely to happen or be in a bad situation
